definition: Atchison or Acheson (name)/Atchison city on Missouri in Kansas, USA
Chinese mugwort or wormwood/moxa/to stop or cut short/phonetic "ai" or "i"/abbr. for 艾滋病[ai4 zi1 bing4], AIDS
to mow/to cut/to reap/to redress
surname Ai
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually
to abdicate/modest/yielding/unpretentious/inferior to/(slang) to suck

sentences.english: Atcheson's company and its competitors screen the driving records of prospective borrowers.
sentences.chinese: 艾奇逊的公司和屏幕准借款人的驾驶记录其竞争对手。

sentences.english: At the close of World War II, Acheson was serving as Under Secretary of State.
sentences.chinese: 在二战接近尾声时，艾奇逊担任副国务卿。

sentences.english: He also began a running feud with Dean Acheson.
sentences.chinese: 他也开始接二连三地和艾奇逊院长发生争执。

definition: Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Wedemeyer (name)/Albert Coady Wedemeyer (1897-1989), US Army commander
Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon
Henry Kissinger (1923-), US academic and politician, Secretary of State 1973-1977
Frederick (name)
Secretary of State
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Richardson (name)
Kennedy (name)/J.F. Kennedy (1917-1963), US Democrat politician, president 1961-1963
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
Marshall (name)/George Catlett Marshall (1880-1959), US general in WWII and Secretary of State 1947-1949, author of the postwar Marshall plan for Europe and Nobel peace laureate
Brzezinski (name)/Zbigniew Brzezinski (1928-2017), Polish-American academic and politician, US National Security Adviser 1977-1981
Bush (name)/George H.W. Bush (1924-2018), US president 1988-1992/George W. Bush (1946-), US President 2000-2008
